artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Neoclassicism Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

styleDefinition.origin: Neoclassicism (Europe and North America, c. mid-18th - early 19th Century AD)
visualCharacteristics: Revival of Classical Greek and Roman aesthetics: order, clarity, balance, logic, and seriousness
Emphasis on strong drawing, clear contours, and defined forms (line over color)
Subjects often drawn from Classical history, mythology, or literature, emphasizing themes of virtue, heroism, patriotism, and rationality
Figures typically appear calm, controlled, and statuesque, often in classical drapery or idealized nudity
Emotional restraint and seriousness of expression
Smooth, highly finished surfaces with suppressed brushwork
Attention to archaeological accuracy in settings and costumes
A reaction against the perceived frivolity and ornamentation of Rococo
techniques: Oil painting simulation with a polished, highly finished surface
Emphasis on precise drawing and clear delineation of forms
Modeling forms with subtle light and shadow, avoiding dramatic Baroque chiaroscuro
styleDefinition.mediumSimulation: Oil painting on canvas (or White Marble Sculpture simulation)

colorPalette.description: Often features restrained, sometimes somber color palettes with strong local colors applied clearly within contours. Avoids Rococo pastels and Baroque drama, aiming for clarity and gravity. Use of strong reds, blues, whites, ochres, and greys is common.

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Smooth, polished finish with minimal visible brushwork. Emphasis is on the clarity of form and line, achieving an almost sculptural surface quality.
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Ordered, stable, and balanced compositions, often symmetrical or arranged horizontally like a classical frieze. Clear, logical structure with figures often parallel to the picture plane. Shallow, clearly defined space is common. Prioritizes rationality and stability.
references: Jacques-Louis David ('Oath of the Horatii', 'Death of Marat')
Antonio Canova ('Psyche Revived by Cupid's Kiss' - sculpture)
Angelica Kauffman ('Cornelia, Mother of the Gracchi')
Benjamin West ('The Death of General Wolfe')

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Flat, even, bright lighting with no discernible source or shadows, typical of Egyptian art.
sceneContext.cameraView: Strict profile or composite view, straight-on perspective, avoiding complex angles.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: A stylized representation of a cave interior or outdoor landscape, framed perhaps with simple geometric Egyptian borders or patterns.

avoid: Dynamic, fluid poses (use stiff Egyptian poses)
